net.netnook.repeg.chars

Class CharMatchers

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.netnook.repeg.chars.CharMatchers

  • public final class CharMatchers
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to produce CharMatchers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static CharMatcher any()
      Create a CharMatcher which matches any character.
      static CharMatcher asciiWhitespace()
      Create a CharMatcher which matches any ASCII whitespace.
      static CharMatcher crlf()
      Create a CharMatcher which matches '\n' or '\r' characters.
      static CharMatcher horizontalWhitespace()
      Create a CharMatcher which matches any horizontal whitespace.
      static CharMatcher in(java.lang.String characters)
      Create a CharMatcher which matches any of the characters in the supplied string of characters.
      static CharMatcher inRange(char from, char to)
      Create a CharMatcher which matches any character in the range from to to (both inclusive).
      static CharMatcher is(char c)
      Create a CharMatcher which matches the specific character c.

        public static CharMatcher crlf()
        Create a CharMatcher which matches '\n' or '\r' characters.

        See CRLFMatcher

        public static CharMatcher is(char c)
        Create a CharMatcher which matches the specific character c.
        Parameters:

      • in

        public static CharMatcher in(java.lang.String characters)
        Create a CharMatcher which matches any of the characters in the supplied string of characters.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the resulting CharMatcher.

      • inRange

        public static CharMatcher inRange(char from,
                                  char to)
        Create a CharMatcher which matches any character in the range from to to (both inclusive).

        Example CharMatcher.inRange('a', 'z') to match any lower case ascii letter.

        Parameters:
        from - the lowest character to match (inclusive).
        to - the highert character to match (inclusive).
        Returns:
        the resulting CharMatcher.
